--- Page 1 ---
 
Introduced Version
SENATE BILL No. 165
_____
DIGEST OF  INTRODUCED B ILL
Citations Affected:  IC 27-1-37.3-5; IC 27-4-10-5; IC 27-8.
Synopsis:  Requirements of short term insurance plans. Requires an
insurer that issues a short term insurance plan to cover certain medical
services. Prohibits an insurer that issues a short term insurance plan
from retroactively cancelling a short term insurance plan except in the
case of fraud. Amends current provisions exempting short term
insurance plans from accident and sickness insurance policy
requirements to provide for a term of not more than 6 months (current
law provides for a term of 364 days).
Effective:  July 1, 2025.
Qaddoura
January 8, 2025, read first time and referred to Commi ttee on Insurance and Financial
Institutions.
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 2 ---
Introduced
First Reg ular Sessio n of the 124th General A ssem bly (2025)
PRINTING CODE. Amendments: Whenever an existing statute (or a section of the Indiana
Constitution) is being amended, the text of the existing provision will appear in this style type,
additions will appear in this sty le type, and deletions will appear in this style type.
  Additions: Whenever a new statutory provision is being enacted (or a new constitutional
provision adopted), the text of the new provision will appear in  this  style  type. Also, the
word NEW will appear in that style type in the introductory clause of each SECTION that adds
a new provision to the Indiana Code or the Indiana Constitution.
  Conflict reconciliation: Text in a statute in this style type or this style type reconciles conflicts
between statutes enacted by the 2024 Regular Session of the General Assembly.
SENATE BILL No. 165
A BILL FOR AN ACT to amend the Indiana Code concerning
insurance.
Be it enacted by the General Assembly of the State of Indiana:
1 SECTION 1. IC 27-1-37.3-5, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
2 SECTION 1, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
3 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 5. (a) As used in this chapter, "health plan" means
4 a plan through which coverage is provided for health care services
5 through insurance, prepayment, reimbursement, or otherwise. The term
6 includes the following:
7 (1) An employee welfare benefit plan (as defined in 29 U.S.C.
8 1002 et seq.).
9 (2) A policy of accident and sickness insurance (as defined in
10 IC 27-8-5-1).
11 (3) An individual contract (as defined in IC 27-13-1-21) or a
12 group contract (as defined in IC 27-13-1-16).
13 (b) The term does not include the following:
14 (1) Accident-only, credit, Medicare supplement, long term care,
15 or disability income insurance.
16 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
17 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 3 ---
2
1 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
2 (5) A specified disease policy issued as an individual policy.
3 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
4 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
5 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
6 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
7 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
8 days; six (6) months; and
9 (C) has an annu al limit of at least two million dollars
10 ($2,000,000).
11 (7) A policy that provides a stipulated daily, weekly, or monthly
12 payment to an insured during hospital confinement, without
13 regard to the actual expense of the confinement.
14 SECTION 2. IC 27-4-10-5, AS ADDED BY P.L.31-2021,
15 SECTION 4, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
16 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 5. (a) As used in this chapter, "health insurance
17 plan" means:
18 (1) a policy of accident and sickness insurance (as defined in
19 IC 27-8-5-1);
20 (2) an individual contract or a group contract with a health
21 maintenance organization under IC 27-13;
22 (3) a:
23 (A) policy of accident and sickness insurance; or
24 (B) limited service health maintenance organization (as
25 defined in IC 27-13-34-4);
26 that provides coverage for dental care services; or
27 (4) another plan or program that provides payment,
28 reimbursement, or indemnification for the costs of health care
29 items or services.
30 (b) The term does not include the following:
31 (1) Accident only, credit, vision, Medicare supplement, long term
32 care, or disability income insurance.
33 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
34 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
35 (4) A specified disease policy.
36 (5) A short term insurance plan that:
37 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
38 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
39 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
40 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
41 days; six (6) months; and
42 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 4 ---
3
1 ($2,000,000).
2 (6) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
3 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
4 coverage for:
5 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
6 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
7 (7) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
8 (8) A student health plan.
9 (9) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
10 coverage.
11 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
12 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
13 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
14 policy.
15 (11) The Medicaid program.
16 SECTION 3. IC 27-8-5-2.5, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
17 SECTION 2, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
18 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 2.5. (a) As used in this section, the term "policy
19 of accident and sickness insurance" does not include the following:
20 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
21 long term care, or disability income insurance.
22 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
23 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
24 (4) A specified disease policy.
25 (5) A short term insurance plan that:
26 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
27 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
28 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
29 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
30 days; six (6) months; and
31 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
32 ($2,000,000).
33 (6) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
34 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
35 coverage for:
36 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
37 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
38 (7) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
39 (8) A student health plan.
40 (9) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
41 coverage.
42 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 5 ---
4
1 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
2 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
3 policy.
4 (b) The benefits provided by:
5 (1) an individual policy of accident and sickness insurance; or
6 (2) a certificate of coverage that is issued under a nonemployer
7 based association group policy of accident and sickness insurance
8 to an individual who is a resident of Indiana;
9 may not be excluded, limited, or denied for more than twelve (12)
10 months after the effective date of the coverage because of a preexisting
11 condition of the individual.
12 (c) An individual policy of accident and sickness insurance or a
13 certificate of coverage described in subsection (b) may not define a
14 preexisting condition, a rider, or an endorsement more restrictively
15 than as:
16 (1) a condition that would have caused an ordinarily prudent
17 person to seek medical advice, diagnosis, care, or treatment
18 during the twelve (12) months immediately preceding the
19 effective date of the plan;
20 (2) a condition for which medical advice, diagnosis, care, or
21 treatment was recommended or received during the twelve (12)
22 months immediately preceding the effective date of the plan; or
23 (3) a pregnancy existing on the effective date of the plan.
24 (d) An insurer shall reduce the period allowed for a preexisting
25 condition exclusion described in subsection (b) by the amount of time
26 the individual has continuously served under a preexisting condition
27 clause for a policy of accident and sickness insurance issued under
28 IC 27-8-15 if the individual applies for a policy under this chapter not
29 more than thirty (30) days after coverage under a policy of accident and
30 sickness insurance issued under IC 27-8-15 expires.
31 SECTION 4. IC 27-8-5-15.6, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
32 SECTION 3, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
33 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 15.6. (a) As used in this section, "coverage of
34 services for a mental illness" includes the services defined under the
35 policy of accident and sickness insurance. However, the term does not
36 include services for the treatment of substance abuse or chemical
37 dependency.
38 (b) This section applies to a policy of accident and sickness
39 insurance that:
40 (1) is issued on an individual basis or a group basis;
41 (2) is issued, entered into, or renewed after December 31, 1999;
42 and
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 6 ---
5
1 (3) is issued to an employer that employs more than fifty (50)
2 full-time employees.
3 (c) This section does not apply to the following:
4 (1) A legal business entity that has obtained an exemption under
5 section 15.7 of this chapter.
6 (2) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
7 long term care, or disability income insurance.
8 (3) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
9 (4) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
10 (5) Automobile medical payment insurance.
11 (6) A specified disease policy.
12 (7) A short term insurance plan that:
13 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
14 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
15 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
16 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
17 days; six (6) months; and
18 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
19 ($2,000,000).
20 (8) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
21 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
22 coverage for:
23 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
24 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
25 (9) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
26 coverage.
27 (10) A student health plan.
28 (11) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
29 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
30 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
31 policy.
32 (d) A group or individual insurance policy or agreement may not
33 permit treatment limitations or financial requirements on the coverage
34 of services for a mental illness if similar limitations or requirements are
35 not imposed on the coverage of services for other medical or surgical
36 conditions.
37 (e) An insurer that issues a policy of accident and sickness
38 insurance that provides coverage of services for the treatment of
39 subst ance abuse and chemical dependency when the services are
40 required in the treatment of a mental illness shall offer to provide the
41 coverage without treatment limitations or financial requirements if
42 similar limitations or requirements are not imposed on the coverage of
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 7 ---
6
1 services for other medical or surgical conditions.
2 (f) This section does not require a group or individual insurance
3 policy or agreement to offer mental health benefits.
4 (g) The benefits delivered under this section may be delivered under
5 a managed care system.
6 SECTION 5. IC 27-8-5-27, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
7 SECTION 4, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
8 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 27. (a) As used in this section, "accident and
9 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that provides at
10 least one (1) of the types of insurance described in IC 27-1-5-1, Classes
11 1(b) and 2(a), and is issued on a group basis. The term does not include
12 the following:
13 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
14 long term care, or disability income insurance.
15 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
16 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
17 (4) A specified disease policy.
18 (5) A short term insurance plan that:
19 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
20 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
21 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
22 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
23 days; six (6) months; and
24 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
25 ($2,000,000).
26 (6) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
27 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
28 coverage for:
29 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
30 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
31 (7) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
32 (8) A student health plan.
33 (9) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
34 coverage.
35 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
36 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
37 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
38 policy.
39 (b) As used in this section, "insured" means a child or an individual
40 with a disability who is entitled to coverage under an accident and
41 sickness insurance policy.
42 (c) As used in this section, "child" means an individual who is less
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 8 ---
7
1 than nineteen (19) years of age.
2 (d) As used in this section, "individual with a disability" means an
3 individual:
4 (1) with a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits
5 one (1) or more of the major life activities of the individual; and
6 (2) who:
7 (A) has a record of; or
8 (B) is regarded as;
9 having an impairment described in subdivision (1).
10 (e) A policy of accident and sickness insurance must include
11 coverage for anesthesia and hospital charges for dental care for an
12 insured if the mental or physical condition of the insured requires
13 dental treatment to be rendered in a hospital or an ambulatory
14 outpatient surgical center. The Indications for General Anesthesia, as
15 published in the reference manual of the American Academy of
16 Pediatric Dentistry, are the utilization standards for determining
17 whether performing dental procedures necessary to treat the insured's
18 condition under general anesthesia constitutes appropriate treatment.
19 (f) An insurer that issues a policy of accident and sickness insurance
20 may:
21 (1) require prior authorization for hospitalization or treatment in
22 an ambulatory outpatient surgical center for dental care
23 procedures in the same manner that prior authorization is required
24 for hospitalization or treatment of other covered medical
25 conditions; and
26 (2) restrict coverage to include only procedures performed by a
27 licensed dentist who has privileges at the hospital or ambulatory
28 outpatient surgical center.
29 (g) This section does not apply to treatment rendered for temporal
30 mandibular joint disorders (TMJ).
31 SECTION 6. IC 27-8-5.6-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
32 SECTION 5, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
33 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, the term "accident
34 and sickness insurance" means any policy or contract covering one (1)
35 or more of the kinds of insurance described in classes 1(b) or 2(a) of
36 IC 27-1-5-1, as governed by IC 27-8-5.
37 (b) The term does not include the following:
38 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
39 long term care, or disability income insurance.
40 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
41 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
42 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 9 ---
8
1 (5) A specified disease policy.
2 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
3 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
4 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
5 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
6 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
7 days; six (6) months; and
8 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
9 ($2,000,000).
10 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
11 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
12 coverage for:
13 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
14 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
15 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
16 coverage.
17 (9) A student health plan.
18 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
19 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
20 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
21 policy.
22 SECTION 7. IC 27-8-5.8-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
23 SECTION 6, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
24 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. As used in this chapter, "accident and sickness
25 insurance policy" means an insurance policy that provides at least one
26 (1) of the types of insurance described in IC 27-1-5-1, Classes 1(b) and
27 2(a), and is issued on a group basis. The term does not include the
28 following:
29 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare, Medicare
30 supplement, long term care, or disability income insurance.
31 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
32 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
33 (4) A specified disease policy.
34 (5) A limited benefit health insurance policy.
35 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
36 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
37 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
38 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
39 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
40 days; six (6) months; and
41 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
42 ($2,000,000).
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 10 ---
9
1 (7) A policy that provides a stipulated daily, weekly, or monthly
2 payment to an insured during hospital confinement, without
3 regard to the actual expense of the confinement.
4 (8) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
5 (9) A student health insurance policy.
6 SECTION 8. IC 27-8-5.9-2.5 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
7 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
8 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 2.5. As used in this chapter,
9 "preexisting condition exclusion" has the meaning set forth in 45
10 CFR 144.103, as in effect on January 1, 2025.
11 SECTION 9. IC 27-8-5.9-3, AS ADDED BY P.L.288-2019,
12 SECTION 7, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
13 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 3. As used in this chapter, "short term insurance
14 plan" means a policy of accident and sickness insurance (as defined in
15 IC 27-8-5-1) that:
16 (1) may be renewed for the greater of:
17 (A) thirty-six (36) months; or
18 (B) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
19 (2) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
20 days; six (6) months; and
21 (3) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
22 ($2,000,000).
23 SECTION 10. IC 27-8-5.9-5, AS ADDED BY P.L.288-2019,
24 SECTION 7, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
25 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 5. A short term insurance plan must include
26 coverage for the following: shall:
27 (1) not impose a preexisting condition exclusion on coverage
28 under the short term insurance plan; and
29 (2) include coverage for the following, as provided under
30 PPACA:
31 (1) (A) Ambulatory patient services.
32 (2) (B) Hospitalization.
33 (3) (C) Emergency services.
34 (4) (D) Laboratory services.
35 (E) Maternity and newborn care.
36 (F) Mental health and substance use disorder servi ces,
37 including behavioral health treatment.
38 (G) Prescription drugs.
39 (H) Rehabilitative and habilitative services and devices.
40 (I) Preventive and wellness services and chronic disease
41 management.
42 (J) Pediatric services, including oral and vision care.
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 11 ---
10
1 SECTION 11. IC 27-8-5.9-10 IS ADDED TO THE INDIANA
2 CODE AS A NEW SECTION TO READ AS FOLLOWS
3 [EFFECTIVE JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 10. An insurer that issues a short
4 term insurance plan may not retroactively cancel a short term
5 insurance plan except in the case of fraud, as provided under
6 PPACA.
7 SECTION 12. IC 27-8-6-6, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
8 SECTION 8, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
9 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 6. (a) As used in this section, "policy of accident
10 and sickness insurance" has the meaning set forth in IC 27-8-5-1.
11 However, the term does not include the following:
12 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
13 long term care, or disability income insurance.
14 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
15 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
16 (4) A specified disease policy.
17 (5) A short term insurance plan that:
18 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
19 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
20 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
21 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
22 days; six (6) months; and
23 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
24 ($2,000,000).
25 (6) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
26 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
27 coverage for:
28 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
29 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
30 (7) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
31 coverage.
32 (b) A policy of accident and sickness insurance that provides
33 coverage for physical medicine and rehabilitative services shall provide
34 the coverage for physical medicine and rehabilitative services that are:
35 (1) rendered by an athletic trainer who is licensed under
36 IC 25-5.1; and
37 (2) within the athletic trainer's scope of practice.
38 (c) This section does not require a policy of accident and sickness
39 insurance to provide coverage for physical medicine or rehabilitative
40 services generally.
41 SECTION 13. IC 27-8-13.4-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
42 SECTION 9, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 12 ---
11
1 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
2 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
3 (1) provides one (1) or more of the types of insurance described
4 in IC 27-1-5-1, Class 1(b) and Class 2(a); and
5 (2) is issued on a group or individual basis.
6 (b) As used in this chapter, "accident and sickness insurance policy"
7 does not include the following:
8 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
9 long term care, or disability income insurance.
10 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
11 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
12 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
13 (5) A specified disease policy.
14 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
15 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
16 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
17 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
18 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
19 days; six (6) months; and
20 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
21 ($2,000,000).
22 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
23 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
24 coverage for:
25 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
26 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
27 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
28 coverage.
29 (9) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
30 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
31 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
32 policy.

36 sickness insurance" has the meaning set forth in IC 27-8-5-1. The term
37 does not include the following:
38 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
39 long term care, or disability income insurance.
40 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
41 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
42 (4) A specified disease policy.

23 SECTION 11, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
24 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
25 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
26 (1) provides one (1) or more of the types of insurance described
27 in IC 27-1-5-1, classes 1(b) and 2(a); and
28 (2) is issued on a group basis.
29 (b) The term does not include the following:
30 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
31 long term care, or disability income insurance.
32 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
33 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
34 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.

37 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
38 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
39 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
40 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
41 days; six (6) months; and

1 ($2,000,000).

3 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
4 coverage for:

6 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
7 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
8 coverage.
9 (9) A student health plan.
10 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
11 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
12 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
13 policy.
14 SECTION 16. IC 27-8-14.1-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
15 SECTION 12, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
16 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
17 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
18 (1) provides one (1) or more of the types of insurance described
19 in IC 27-1-5-1, classes 1(b) and 2(a); and
20 (2) is issued on a group basis.
21 (b) As used in this chapter, "accident and sickness insurance policy"
22 does not include the following:
23 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
24 long term care, or disability income insurance.
25 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
26 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
27 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
28 (5) A specified disease policy.
29 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
30 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
31 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
32 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
33 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
34 days; six (6) months; and
35 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
36 ($2,000,000).
37 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
38 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
39 coverage for:
40 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
41 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
42 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 15 ---
14
1 coverage.
2 (9) A student health plan.
3 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
4 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
5 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
6 policy.
7 SECTION 17. IC 27-8-14.2-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
8 SECTION 13, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
9 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
10 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that provides one
11 (1) or more of the types of insurance described in IC 27-1-5-1, classes
12 1(b) and 2(a).
13 (b) The term does not include the following:
14 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
15 long term care, or disability income insurance.
16 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
17 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
18 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
19 (5) A specified disease policy.
20 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
21 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
22 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
23 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
24 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
25 days; six (6) months; and
26 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
27 ($2,000,000).
28 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
29 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
30 coverage for:
31 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
32 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
33 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
34 coverage.
35 (9) A student health plan.
36 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
37 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
38 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
39 policy.

42 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 2. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 16 ---
15
1 sickness policy" means an insurance policy that provides at least one
2 (1) of the types of insurance described in IC 27-1-5-1, Classes 1(b) and
3 2(a).
4 (b) The term "accident and sickness policy" does not include the
5 following:
6 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
7 long term care, or disability income insurance.
8 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
9 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
10 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
11 (5) A specified disease policy.
12 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
13 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
14 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
15 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
16 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
17 days; six (6) months; and
18 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
19 ($2,000,000).
20 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
21 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
22 coverage for:
23 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
24 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
25 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
26 coverage.
27 (9) A student health plan.
28 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
29 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
30 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
31 policy.
32 SECTION 19. IC 27-8-14.5-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
33 SECTION 14, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
34 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "health insurance
35 plan" means any:
36 (1) hospital or medical expense incurred policy or certificate;
37 (2) hospital or medical service plan contract; or
38 (3) health maintenance organization subscriber contract;
39 provided to an insured.
40 (b) The term does not include the following:
41 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
42 long term care, or disability income insurance.

--- Page 17 ---
16
1 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
2 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
3 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
4 (5) A specified disease policy.
5 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
6 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
7 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
8 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
9 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
10 days; six (6) months; and
11 (C) has an annual  limit of at least two million dollars
12 ($2,000,000).
13 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
14 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
15 coverage for:
16 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
17 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.

25 SECTION 20. IC 27-8-14.7-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
26 SECTION 15, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
27 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
28 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
29 (1) provides at least one (1) of the types of insurance described in
30 IC 27-1-5-1, Classes 1(b) and 2(a); and
31 (2) is issued on a group basis.
32 (b) "Accident and sickness insurance policy" does not include the
33 following:
34 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
35 long term care, or disability income insurance.
36 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
37 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
38 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
39 (5) A specified disease policy.
40 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
41 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
42 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 18 ---
17
1 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
2 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
3 days; six (6) months; and
4 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
5 ($2,000,000).
6 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
7 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
8 coverage for:
9 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
10 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
11 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
12 coverage.
13 (9) A student health plan.
14 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
15 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
16 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
17 policy.
18 SECTION 21. IC 27-8-14.8-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
19 SECTION 16, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
20 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
21 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
22 (1) provides at least one (1) of the types of insurance described in
23 IC 27-1-5-1, Classes 1(b) and 2(a); and
24 (2) is issued on a group basis.
25 (b) "Accident and sickness insurance policy" does not include the
26 following:
27 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
28 long term care, or disability income insurance.
29 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
30 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
31 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
32 (5) A specified disease policy.
33 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
34 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
35 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
36 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
37 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
38 days; six (6) months; and
39 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
40 ($2,000,000).
41 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
42 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 19 ---
18
1 coverage for:
2 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
3 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
4 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
5 coverage.
6 (9) A student health plan.
7 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
8 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
9 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
10 policy.
11 SECTION 22. IC 27-8-15-9, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
12 SECTION 17, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
13 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 9. (a) Except as provided in section 28 of this
14 chapter, as used in this chapter, "health insurance plan" or "plan"
15 means any:
16 (1) hospital or medical expense incurred policy or certificate;
17 (2) hospital or medical service plan contract; or
18 (3) health maintenance organization subscriber contract;
19 provided to the employees of a small employer.
20 (b) The term does not include the following:
21 (1) Accident-only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
22 long term care, or disability income insurance.
23 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
24 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
25 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
26 (5) A specified disease policy.
27 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
28 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
29 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
30 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
31 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
32 days; six (6) months; and
33 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
34 ($2,000,000).
35 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
36 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
37 coverage for:
38 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
39 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
40 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
41 coverage.
42 (9) A student health plan.
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 20 ---
19
1 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
2 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
3 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
4 policy.
5 SECTION 23. IC 27-8-24.1-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
6 SECTION 18, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
7 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
8 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that provides at
9 least one (1) of the types of insurance described in IC 27-1-5-1, Classes
10 1(b) and 2(a), and is issued on a group basis.
11 (b) The term does not include the following:
12 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
13 long term care, or disability income insurance.
14 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
15 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
16 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
17 (5) A specified disease policy.
18 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
19 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
20 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
21 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
22 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
23 days; six (6) months; and
24 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
25 ($2,000,000).
26 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
27 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
28 coverage for:
29 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
30 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
31 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
32 coverage.
33 (9) A student health plan.
34 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
35 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
36 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
37 policy.
38 SECTION 24. IC 27-8-24.2-3, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
39 SECTION 19, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
40 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 3. (a) As used in this chapter, "policy of accident
41 and sickness insurance" has the meaning set forth in IC 27-8-5-1.
42 (b) The term does not include the following:
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 21 ---
20
1 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare, Medicare
2 supplement, long term care, or disability income insurance.
3 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
4 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
5 (4) A specified disease policy.
6 (5) A limited benefit health insurance policy.
7 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
8 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
9 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
10 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
11 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
12 days; six (6) months; and
13 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
14 ($2,000,000).
15 (7) A policy that provides a stipulated daily, weekly, or monthly
16 payment to an insured during hospital confinement, without
17 regard to the actual expense of the confinement.
18 (8) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
19 (9) A student health insurance policy.
20 SECTION 25. IC 27-8-27-4, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
21 SECTION 20, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
22 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 4. (a) For purposes of this chapter, "health
23 insurance plan" means any:
24 (1) hospital or medical expense incurred policy or certificate;
25 (2) hospital or medical service plan contract; or
26 (3) health maintenance organization subscriber contract;
27 provided to an insured.
28 (b) The term does not include the following:
29 (1) Accident-only, credit, dental, Medicare supplement, long term
30 care, or disability income insurance.
31 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
32 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
33 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
34 (5) A specified disease policy issued as an individual policy.
35 (6) A limited benefit health insurance plan issued as an individual
36 policy.
37 (7) A short term insurance plan that:
38 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
39 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
40 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
41 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
42 days; six (6) months; and
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 22 ---
21
1 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
2 ($2,000,000).
3 (8) A policy that provides a stipulated daily, weekly, or monthly
4 payment to an insured during hospital confinement, without
5 regard to the actual expense of the confinement.
6 SECTION 26. IC 27-8-28-1, AS AMENDED BY P.L.288-2019,
7 SECTION 21, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
8 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 1. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
9 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that provides one
10 (1) or more of the kinds of insurance described in Class 1(b) and 2(a)
11 of IC 27-1-5-1.
12 (b) The term does not include the following:
13 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
14 long term care, or disability income insurance.
15 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
16 (3) Automobile medical payment insurance.
17 (4) A specified disease policy issued as an individual policy.
18 (5) A limited benefit health insurance policy issued as an
19 individual policy.
20 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
21 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
22 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
23 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
24 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
25 days; six (6) months; and
26 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
27 ($2,000,000).
28 (7) A policy that provides a stipulated daily, weekly, or monthly
29 payment to an insured during hospital confinement without regard
30 to the actual expense of the confinement.
31 (8) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
32 SECTION 27. IC 27-8-38-2, AS ADDED BY P.L.170-2022,
33 SECTION 38, IS AMENDED TO READ AS FOLLOWS [EFFECTIVE
34 JULY 1, 2025]: Sec. 2. (a) As used in this chapter, "accident and
35 sickness insurance policy" means an insurance policy that:
36 (1) provides at least one (1) of the types of insurance described in
37 IC 27-1-5-1, Classes 1(b) and 2(a); and
38 (2) is issued on:
39 (A) an individual basis; or
40 (B) a group basis.
41 (b) "Accident and sickness insurance policy" does not include the
42 following:
2025 IN 165—LS 6502/DI 154


--- Page 23 ---
22
1 (1) Accident only, credit, dental, vision, Medicare supplement,
2 long term care, or disability income insurance.
3 (2) Coverage issued as a supplement to liability insurance.
4 (3) Worker's compensation or similar insurance.
5 (4) Automobile medical payment insurance.
6 (5) A specified disease policy.
7 (6) A short term insurance plan that:
8 (A) may be renewed for the greater of:
9 (i) thirty-six (36) months; or
10 (ii) the maximum period permitted under federal law;
11 (B) has a term of not more than three hundred sixty-four (364)
12 days; six (6) months; and
13 (C) has an annual limit of at least two million dollars
14 ($2,000,000).
15 (7) A policy that provides indemnity benefits not based on any
16 expense incurred requirement, including a plan that provides
17 coverage for:
18 (A) hospital confinement, critical illness, or intensive care; or
19 (B) gaps for deductibles or copayments.
20 (8) A supplemental plan that always pays in addition to other
21 coverage.
22 (9) A student health plan.
23 (10) An employer sponsored health benefit plan that is:
24 (A) provided to individuals who are eligible for Medicare; and
25 (B) not marketed as, or held out to be, a Medicare supplement
26 policy.
